task

Class ToDoListManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • task.ToDoListManager

  • public class ToDoListManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class ToDoListManager models a to-do list.

    The user is presented with a menu from which they can choose to:

  • Add task
  • Remove task
  • View tasks
  • Save tasks
  • Load tasks
  • Sort by title
  • Sort by priority
  • Sort by completion
Version:
1.2 April 22, 2016
Author:
Lucas Melin

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToDoListManager

        public ToDoListManager()
        Instantiates the scanner and the ArrayList that holds the tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • runToDoList

        public void runToDoList()
        Runs the toDoList selection.

        Invokes menu and then receives user input. Based on the user input, methods are called on the tasks ArrayList such as:

      • Add task
      • Remove task
      • View tasks
      • Save tasks
      • Load tasks
      • Sort by title
      • Sort by priority
      • Sort by completion

  • showMenu

    private void showMenu()
    Outputs menu on console, only called from runToDoList.

  • addTask

    private void addTask()
    Adds the task.

    Get inputs from the user for task title and task priority. Instantiates a Task using the constructor. Assign the reference to the Task into the ArrayList named tasks. If an exception is thrown, the method ends.

  • toggleTaskComplete

    private void toggleTaskComplete()
    Toggles task completion boolean.

    Checks that there are tasks. Asks user for index of Task in the ArrayList to toggle. After obtaining the Task from the ArrayList flip the isCompleted boolean.

  • removeTask

    private void removeTask()
    Removes the task.

    Check that there are tasks before doing anything else. Ask user for index of Task in the ArrayList to remove. If an exception is thrown, the method ends.

  • viewTasks

    private void viewTasks()
    Displays information about all tasks.

    Formats tasks using the toString method, then displays them on-screen along with their index location in the array.

  • saveTasks

    private void saveTasks()
    Saves tasks found in the ArrayList to a file.

    Each task is separated by a newline, and the tasks are formatted using the createTabRecord method, which separates the values of the task with tab characters. This method also overwrites any previous files of the same name.

  • loadTasks

    private void loadTasks()
    Loads tasks from a text file into an ArrayList.

    Splits each line of the text file into a String array, splitting on the tab character Creates a new task based on the data split from the line, then appends the task to the ArrayList.

  • sortByTitle

    private void sortByTitle()
    Sorts the task list using the TaskTitleComparator comparator.

    Checks to make sure that the array is not empty before attempting to compare elements.

  • sortByPriority

    private void sortByPriority()
    Sorts the task list using the TaskPriorityComparator comparator.

    Checks to make sure that the array is not empty before attempting to compare elements.

  • sortByIsComplete

    private void sortByIsComplete()
    Sorts the task list using the TaskIsCompleteComparator comparator.

    Checks to make sure that the array is not empty before attempting to compare elements.
